isis.stitle: DIAMONDLIFE™ (BOSCH PIN SLIDE) DISC BRAKES For Vehicles Built After June 2, 2002 - clean and inspect - ANCHOR PLATE AND SPLASH SHIELD

svcsubproc.title: Clean and Inspect Anchor Plate Components

warning.para: If you use cleaning solvents, hot solution tanks or alkaline solutions incorrectly, serious personal injury can occur. To prevent injury, follow the instructions supplied by the manufacturer. Do not use gasoline to clean parts. Gasoline can explode.

note.para: When using compressed air, use air lines that are completely free of oil and moisture.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 48 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Clean anchor plate, guide pin bores and brake pad abutments (Items 1, 2 and 3) with a brush and solvent. Use compressed air to clean out and dry guide pin bores.
Check guide pin bores (Item 2) for excessive wear. Replace anchor plate if necessary.

figure.caption: Figure 48. Clean And Inspect Anchor Plate

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 49 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Make sure anchor plate pad abutments (Item 1), anchor plate tie bar mounting surfaces (Item 2), axle flange mounting surface (Item 3) and anchor plate tie bar pads (Item 4), if so equipped (73 mm brakes only) are clean and free of any rust or corrosion.

Use a hand held wire brush to clean these surfaces. It is important to clean these areas of the anchor plate. Also make sure the tie bar mounting threads (Item 5) are clean and free of foreign matter.

figure.caption: Figure 49. Clean And Inspect Anchor Plate Component Mating Surfaces

calloutgroup.callout1: 2. ANCHOR PLATE TIE BAR MOUNTING SURFACE
4. ANCHOR PLATE TIE BAR PAD MOUNTING SURFACE
5. ANCHOR PLATE TIE BAR MOUNTING THREADS

step1.para: Make sure guide pin bores are free of foreign matter and corrosion. If not clean, use a wire bore brush with solvent and clean out guide pin bores. Use compressed air to clean and dry. Wipe out the bore with a dry, clean, lint free cloth.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 50 for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para:
Clean abutment slippers (Item 4) and ABS sensor bracket (Item 1, Figure 43)
with solvent. Use compressed air to clean and dry. Wipe off with a dry, clean, lint free cloth.

Make sure bolt threads in leading and trailing guide pins (Items 1 and 2) are free of foreign matter. Make sure caliper hex flanged mounting bolts (Figure 70)
thread in and out of leading and trailing guide pins by hand.

Check guide pin boots (Item 3) for damage or defects. If damage or defects are found, they must be replaced. If guide pin boots are not damaged or defective, wash them in soapy water and dry them. Once again, after the guide pin boots have been cleaned and dried, inspect them for damage or defects. If damage or defects are found, they must be replaced.
Inspect abutment slippers (Item 4) for damage or wear. Replace if damaged or excessive wear is present.

figure.caption: Figure 50. Clean and Inspect Guide Pin Boots and Abutment Slippers

step1.para:
Once the anchor plate and splash shield has been cleaned and inspected, refer to ANCHOR PLATE AND SPLASH SHIELD, Assemble
to assemble and rebuild the anchor plate and splash shield.
